description: The X-Content-Type-Options response header is a marker used by the server to indicate that the MIME types advertised in the Content-Type headers should not be changed and be followed.

response-directives.description: Prevents browsers from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type.
response-directives.details: When the browser receives a response with this header set, it will refuse to change the content type and will treat it as if the server had specified the declared content-type in the response.
